item.title: Jessie add a quote by William Shakespear
item.description: "There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so." -- William Shakespear

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "The human heart has hidden treasures, In secret kept, in silence sealed; The thoughts, the hopes, the dreams, the pleasures, Whose charms were broken if revealed." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Jessie add a quote by George Gordon Byron
item.description: "If I do not write to empty my mind, I go mad." -- George Gordon Byron

item.title: Jessie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Let me not to the marriage of true minds Admit impediments. Love is not love Which alters when it alteration finds, Or bends with the remover to remove. O no, it is an ever-fixed mark That looks on tempests and is never shaken; It is the star to every wand'ring barque, Whose worth's unknown, although his height be taken. Love's not Time's fool, though rosy lips and cheeks Within his bending sickle's compass come; Love alters not with his brief hours and weeks, But bears it out even to the edge of doom. If this be error and upon me proved, I never writ, nor no man ever loved." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Time doth flit; oh shit." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "They sicken of the calm who know the storm." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Lord Byron
item.description: "The great object of life is sensation- to feel that we exist, even though in pain." -- Lord Byron

item.title: Jessie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jessie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jessie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "This above all: to thine own self be true, And it must follow, as the night the day, Thou canst not then be false to any man." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "When I was young and bold and strong, The right was right, the wrong was wrong. With plume on high and flag unfurled, I rode away to right the world. But now I’m old - and good and bad, Are woven in a crazy plaid. I sit and say the world is so, And wise is s/he who lets it go." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Prejudices, it is well known, are most difficult to eradicate from the heart whose soil has never been loosened or fertilised by education: they grow there, firm as weeds among stones." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "I'm for truth, no matter who tells it. I'm for justice, no matter who it is for or against. I'm a human being, first and foremost, and as such I'm for whoever and whatever benefits humanity as a whole." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Authors and actors and artists and such - Never know nothing, and never know much." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Jessie add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "The man who never alters his opinion is like standing water, and breeds reptiles of the mind." -- William Blake

item.title: Jessie add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "Improvement makes strait roads, but the crooked roads without Improvement, are roads of Genius." -- William Blake

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description: "Let the rain kiss you. Let the rain beat upon your head with silver liquid drops. Let the rain sing you a lullaby." -- Langston Hughes

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "No single event can awaken within us a stranger whose existence we had never suspected. To live is to be slowly born." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Jessie add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Goodbye," said the fox. "And now here is my secret, a very simple secret: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Harold Pinter
item.description: "There are some things one remembers even though they may never have happened." -- Harold Pinter

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Antoine De Saint-Exupery
item.description: "C'est tellement mystérieux, le pays des larmes." -- Antoine De Saint-Exupery

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Robert Benchley
item.description: "We are constantly being surprised that people did things well before we were born." -- Robert Benchley

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "This is my invariable advice to people: Learn how to cook- try new recipes, learn from your mistakes, be fearless, and above all have fun!" -- Julia Child

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Women have served all these centuries as looking glasses possessing the magic and delicious power of reflecting the figure of man at twice its natural size." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well." -- Virginia Woolf
